question.text:
Different types of assisted reproductive techniques are given below.

a. ZIFT
b. IUT
c. ICSI
d. GIFT
e. AI

Select the correct type of fertilisation in the above techniques.

options.text: In vitro → d, b, c ; In vivo → a, e
In vitro → a, b, c; In vivo → d, e
In vitro → d, e; In vivo → a, b, c
In vitro → a, c, e; In vivo → b, d

solution.text: In-vitro fertilization is a technique of letting fertilisation of the male and female gametes (sperm and egg) occur outside the female body, e.g., intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI), zygote intra-fallopian transfer (ZIFT), IUT. In-vivo fertilization of a ripe egg occurs within the uterus of a fertile donor female, rather than in an artificial medium, for subsequent nonsurgical transfer to an infertile recipient, e.g., gamete intra-fallopian tube transfer (GIFT), artificial insemination (AI).
